INDIANA UNIVERSITY
BLOOMINGTON, INDIANA
RADIO AND TELEVISION SERVICE
December 3. 1957
Mr* Harold E* Hill
MS 7
Associate Director
National Association of
Educational Broadcasters
14 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harold:
Thank you very much for getting out the questionnaire* Regarding the
matter of offering a summary to the Newsletter, both as to the results
of the survey as well as general public relations news, I would, of
course, be most happy to do so* However, before making definite plans
regarding the latter, let’s see what I come up with in the nature of
news. Maybe the whole idea will prove a bust*
I think probably that I might be able to get out a pretty complete
study regarding the public relations situation in general of our educa-
tional stations, and it might be worthwhile for the NAEB to consider
reproducing this entire study for distribution to the membership. I
haven’t said anything to Jim about this, but I am shooting him a copy
of this letter. After all, the survey is pretty useless unless we
make its contents known to our membership*
I could just picture you on Thanksgiving Day. I did the same so now
I am starting a rigorous two weeks diet*
Give my best to Dorothy.
Radio and Television Communications
EGS/cdm
cc: James S. Milgg
Director, WBAA
